package cache

import (
	
	

	
)
ObjectLRU implements an object cache with an LRU eviction policy and a maximum size (measured in object size).
type ObjectLRU struct {
	MaxSize FileSize

	actualSize FileSize
	ll         *list.List
	cache      map[interface{}]*list.Element
	mut        sync.Mutex
}
NewObjectLRU creates a new ObjectLRU with the given maximum size. The maximum size will never be exceeded.
func ( FileSize) *ObjectLRU {
	return &ObjectLRU{MaxSize: }
}
NewObjectLRUDefault creates a new ObjectLRU with the default cache size.
func () *ObjectLRU {
	return &ObjectLRU{MaxSize: DefaultMaxSize}
}
Put puts an object into the cache. If the object is already in the cache, it will be marked as used. Otherwise, it will be inserted. A single object might be evicted to make room for the new object.
func ( *ObjectLRU) ( plumbing.EncodedObject) {
	.mut.Lock()
	defer .mut.Unlock()

	if .cache == nil {
		.actualSize = 0
		.cache = make(map[interface{}]*list.Element, 1000)
		.ll = list.New()
	}

	 := FileSize(.Size())
	 := .Hash()
	if ,  := .cache[];  {
in this case objSize is a delta: new size - old size
		 -= FileSize(.Size())
		.ll.MoveToFront()
		.Value = 
	} else {
		if  > .MaxSize {
			return
		}
		 := .ll.PushFront()
		.cache[] = 
	}

	.actualSize += 
	for .actualSize > .MaxSize {
		 := .ll.Back()
		if  == nil {
			.actualSize = 0
			break
		}

		 := .Value.(plumbing.EncodedObject)
		 := FileSize(.Size())

		.ll.Remove()
		delete(.cache, .Hash())
		.actualSize -= 
	}
}
Get returns an object by its hash. It marks the object as used. If the object is not in the cache, (nil, false) will be returned.
func ( *ObjectLRU) ( plumbing.Hash) (plumbing.EncodedObject, bool) {
	.mut.Lock()
	defer .mut.Unlock()

	,  := .cache[]
	if ! {
		return nil, false
	}

	.ll.MoveToFront()
	return .Value.(plumbing.EncodedObject), true
}
Clear the content of this object cache.
func ( *ObjectLRU) () {
	.mut.Lock()
	defer .mut.Unlock()

	.ll = nil
	.cache = nil
	.actualSize = 0
